section.name: DateTool Reference Documentation
section.p: Tool for manipulating java.util.Date and java.util.Calendar objects in Velocity templates. It supports locales to format dates language and country specific.

method.name: getDate()
method.abstract: Returns a Date object representing the time at which this method was invoked.

parameters.parameter: An object of class java.util.Locale that represents the locale to be used to create the date.

method.returns: An object of class java.util.Date representing the time at which this method was invoked in the specified locale. If no locale is specified, the system's default locale is used.

method.name: getCalendar()
method.abstract: Returns a Calendar object representing the time at which this method was invoked.

parameters.parameter: An object of class java.util.Locale that represents the locale to be used to create the calendar.

method.returns: An object of class java.util.Calendar representing the time at which this method was invoked in the specified locale. If no locale is specified, the system's default locale is used.

method.name: format()
method.abstract: Returns a formatted string representing the specified date.
method.signature: String format(String format, Object obj, Locale locale)

parameters.parameter: A string that represents the formatting instructions according to java.text.SimpleDateFormat. See also below.
An object of class java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar. It is also possible to pass a string that represents a parsable date according to java.text.DateFormat.
An object of class java.util.Locale that represents the locale to format the date for.

description.p: This methods use the same formatting instructions as class java.text.SimpleDateFormat.

method.name: toDate()
method.abstract: Returns a Date object representing the specified date.

parameters.parameter: The date to convert. The parameter can be an object of class java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar. It is also possible to pass a string that represents a parsable date according to java.text.DateFormat.

method.returns: An object of class java.util.Date representing the converted date or of the input parameter is invalid.

method.name: toCalendar()
method.abstract: Returns a Calendar object representing the specified date.

parameters.parameter: The date to convert. The parameter can be an object of class java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar. It is also possible to pass a string that represents a parsable date according to java.text.DateFormat.

method.returns: An object of class java.util.Calendar representing the converted date or of the input parameter is invalid.
